document.topic_text: The Lure Of Gravel Bicycling with Walter Rhein At first, I scoffed at the idea. Riding 100 miles on gravel? What’s the point? Riding 100 miles on pavement is hard enough. Even when I run on gravel, it’s slower, the ground sinks with every kick; on bicycles, your tires spin out and send up clouds of choking dust. Subscribe or log in to read the rest of this content.
